name: Catalonia Royal Bavaro

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service: The service was okay, its only once you got to know the staff you received better service. Majority of the staff speaks Spanish, my husband and I had challenges with the communication as we only spoke English. The room service was slow it take approximately 1 hour or so.
reviews.title: Pros and Cons

likes.liked: — That it was a vacation on the beach with hot weather
likes.disliked: — Communication barriers with the staff- they barely speak English

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have visited this resort 3 times now.
reviews.title: Visit 3 in a year

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This time we went for both Christmas and New Years!
reviews.title: third time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort was as out last visit in March. Divine!
reviews.title: Awesome!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort is as clean as ever and all the workers there aim to please!
reviews.title: Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were recognized and respected by everyone. It makes it hard to want to go anywhere else!
reviews.title: Food
Amazing Trip, Fantastic Resort
reviews.text: We arrived 30 September 2007, stayed on the Royal side (more on that later) check-in was easy, the weather was beautiful, and the pina coladas and banana mamas were ice-cold.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a slight problem with our door-lock, so the concierge kindly grabbed our luggage, stored it out of sight, as my better-half and I took in the fabulous pool and poolside bar.
reviews.title: Great experience!

likes.liked: — The hospitality of the hotel staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: 30 minutes later, we had fantastic suite with cold beer, a free bottle of rum, and a fruit basket. Booze aside, the room, pool, restaurants, club, shopping, shows, and people were perfect.
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort with sub-par food.

likes.liked: — The room was modern, spacious, and clean.
likes.disliked: — The food was terrible 90% of the time (thank goodness for breakfast :) )

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only downside was the beach which had occasional seaweed and was only 90% sand under water. Don't get me wrong, it was great, but there are better beaches to be had.
reviews.title: Absolutely the best vacation

likes.disliked: — being american I expect quick service and I didnt get that but it didnt bother me.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach on the normal side of the resort was better, and the snorkeling with the thousands of multi-coloured fish was incredible. For only $25, make sure you try it.
reviews.title: Royal side - a fantastic, relaxing vacation

likes.liked: — Royal Upgrade! Great private pool and beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I had a great time at this resort. The only "problem" was the weather. It was a little too windy for my liking. It felt about 20 degrees, when I was hoping for 30. Also, the Olga storm didn't help! It rained nonstop for only one day, but rained on occasion during the other 6 days.
reviews.title: Very enjoyable vacation

likes.liked: — Great food and great selection of drinks.
likes.disliked: — Restaurant closed from 10:30 - 12:30 'cause I usually got up at 11!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: About the resort itself: the people working at the resort are fantastic! The resort is beautiful. We booked the "non-Royal" side of the resort and upgraded to Royal when we got to the hotel. We were so glad we did. The pool and beach is so much quieter on the Royal side. Plus, the restaurant, Thalyssa (exclusive to Royal), is the best restaurant in the resort. The Japanese and Mexican restauarnts are good, worth trying once. The French restaurant was so-so. The buffet was horrible. We did not try the steakhouse because we heard it was not very good. Thalyssa had veal medallion, which was awesome, so we didn't feel the need to go to the steakhouse.
reviews.title: very relaxing!

likes.disliked: — Christmas songs played in repetition in restaurant on Royal side

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took one excursion called "Bavaro Runners", where we went into the rural areas and got a glimpse of how the residents lived. We had a great time. Our tour operator (Mimi) was hilarious!
reviews.title: Relaxing !!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want to book at the Royal Catalonia (adults only), I would recommend booking the Catalonia (non-Royal) resort then upgrade to Royal when you get there. It's only an extra $20US/pp/night for the upgrade, which cost us less than $300 for the week. Had we booked the Royal resort with the travel agency, it would have cost us an extra $1,000. Not sure why the huge price discrepancy....
reviews.title: Absolutely Fantastic, Couldnt ask for more!

likes.liked: — The rooms were fantastic, the service and food on the Royal Side was great,
likes.disliked: — The Buffet and the Theme restaurants on the normal side were very poor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent the first week of December at this resort and found it to be a very relaxing vacation! Originally planned to stay on the other part of the resort but upon check in decided to upgrade to the Royal. The adults only pool was wonderful! And although as some people pointed out there was some seaweed at the beach, it was still beautiful and didn't stop us from going in! There is definitely a much sandier beach area for the regular part of the resort, but we definitely liked that the area reserved for people staying on the Royal side was quieter. There seemed to be quite a few activities available if you wanted to participate, but I can't really give a review on these as the only activity I really involved myself in was walking back and forth from the beach to the pool to the beach, and flipping the pages on my book!
reviews.title: Most Amazing Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I went to this resort and had a pretty fun time. The beach was beautiful and worth finding a spot. The water was fine even if there was a little sea weed that was fine they racked it twice a day.
reviews.title: Worth the money spent

likes.disliked: — it was such a long walk to and from everything

reviews.title: Outstanding Resort
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I went to Catalonia Royal Resort from 22 to 29 March 2008. It was our 6th trip to Dominican Republica. This trip was by far the most outstanding resort of all the resorts we stayed at. We enjoyed the VIP section and VIP ammenuities. The pool area is small, extremely clean, quiet and the service at the bar was excellent. The VIP restaurant is simply oustanding. The food is excellent. If you consider that this is a VIP restaurant, we felt that there was one waitress in particular who did not understand English well enough. She was mainly serving breakfast and lunch. What I recommend is that you learn how to say in Spanish what you would like to order for breakfast. The supper meals were outstanding. The rooms were extremely beautiful and clean. There is a huge bath in the rooms, but it is not a jacuzzi (which would have been nice). My boyfriend and I enjoy a quiet and small resort, which is exactly what the Catalonia Royal Resort is all about. However, should you feel like participating in the daily activities, or feel like listening to loud music and so on, you can go to the regular Catalonia Resort Section, which is just beside yours. You can go for a long walk on the Catalonia Section, which is really beautiful. We didn't watch a lot of the entertainment, but it looked allright. The Specialty Restaurants are simply outstanding. We met acquaintances of ours who stayed at the Catalonia Resort Section and they were not too impressed with the Specialty Restaurants, but I strongly believe that depending on the colour of your bracelet, you get different quality of meals/meat (if you stay at the Royal, you have a specific bracelet). We would go back in a heart beat to this resort. The only downsize to this resort is the beach. If you are a beach lover and are spending every minute you have on the beach, you may want to think twice about this resort. I found there was a smell as you got closer to the water. The Royal Section has a private section on the beach, but the smell is still there. There are a lot of weeds in the water; coral at the bottom of the sea where you swim. Way too much weeds on the sand where the water hits the sand. It's too bad, because the rest of the resort is outstanding. As for my boyfriend and I, we spend most of our holiday by the pool, so it didn't really impact our holiday. The food is definitely a 5. The accommodations are a 4.5/5. The pool is 5. The service is a 5. I can't rate the entertainment. The beach is a 3.5/4 (sorry). The Royal Resort is for quiet adults who enjoy reading, swimming and so on. It is not a resort for a loud croud.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Just came back from one of the most enjoyable holidays we've ever had. We stayed in the "Royal" section of the Catalonia Resort and it was absolutely worth it. Royal guests have access to the entire resort but have there on little corner of paradise to retreat to.
reviews.title: Outstanding Experience

likes.liked: — Size of room. Hot water & water pressure.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The staff are extremely friendly, professional and were a large part of the reason we had such a good time. They work very hard and deserve your gratitude.
reviews.title: Great vacation!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Royal Section is for adults only and has it's own lobby & front desk (airconditioned) with bar, & free internet. It also has it's own restaurant which has quite an impressive menu.
reviews.title: Wonderful time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Villa rooms are large with a king size bed, 2 person tub, a LCD TV, a sitting area, A/C, balcony with 2 chairs and a hammock. Only thing missing was an iron and a room clock. The bathroom had a large shower stall with lot's of hot water and good water pressure.
reviews.title: You won't be disappointed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel staff (from front desk to housekeeping): 6
reviews.title: total paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want total peace and relaxation then this is the place for you, We stayed from the 17th dec for two weeks. The de luxe suites are certainly worth the extra being near the beach and very modern..
reviews.title: welcome to paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thelasso restaurant is great for breakfast and al a carte evening meals. Tapas is lovely near the lake for evening meals and sea Blue is nice for lunch only being virtually on the beach. Be warned that they do insist on closed shoes and long pants for men in the evening at all eateries.
reviews.title: Great Christmas Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The staff are absolutely outstanding. I have never before experienced such sincerity and desire to please from the concierge to bar staff, all just want you to enjoy your holiday. I have never been asked so many times if everything was ok and could they do anything to improve my stay. I had to keep pinching myself. I cannot select one member of staff as they were all fantastic.
reviews.title: Excellent Trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Standards at the sister hotel are not quite to the same standard but the evening shows were great and the only poor food was at The Rodeo Steak House. The Japanese was fantastic.
reviews.title: Relaxing Vacation, Probably Won't Be Back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012
reviews.text: The beach is great, clean and sugar white sand with an abundance of sun beds and shade. They do suffer from a lot of sea grass but they work very hard to keep it from guests. Take some bread out and snorkel about 100 metres from the beach. Within seconds dozens of beautiful fish will be eating from your hands.
reviews.title: Great place, great experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Catalonia Royal Bavaro from Dec 6 - 13th. We simply did not want to leave. Everything about it was wonderful. I really do not know how people can say that the service, food or the lack of English was a problem. We have never encountered more friendly or helpful staff, the food was amazing and we never had a communication problem. Our room was cleaned to a very high standard every day, we were always well stocked, there was no odor of any type about the room and the bed was very comfortable. We were on the main floor and faced the back of the building which we preferred as it was more private looking over the gardens and we enjoyed sitting out in the morning and having our coffee.
reviews.title: absolutely loved it!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach was beautiful and that is where we spent our time. It was well shaded, which we like, although you had no problem finding sun.
reviews.title: 3rd and final trip to the Royal Catalonia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What I really loved about this resort was its size - just perfect. It was big enough that you had variety, but small enough that you soon knew and recognized most of the staff and they knew you.
reviews.title: Dream In Republica Dominicana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would definitely go back here. We were looking for a quiet relaxing holiday and that is exactly what we got.
reviews.title: lovely grounds pools and beach but unfortunately thats it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012
reviews.text: C Schofield
reviews.title: Muy Bien!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Catalonia Royal Bavaro for a week. It was our second visit and we loved it just as much as the first time!
reviews.title: Great escape for couples looking for a relaxing vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: What we love about this resort... No kids! Low-key, relaxing ambiance. Outstanding food, in particular at the Cata Tapa restaurant. Very friendly staff: kudos to Cecilia, Victor Fontana, Carlos Mercedes, and Andres Jimenez for making our trip even more enjoyable with their smiles & attention to detail. Beautiful infinity pool. Calm ocean water. Delicious fruit juice bar on the beach. Top-shelf liquor. Modern decor. Conveniently close to the airport. Wonderful crepes at the Catalonia next door (thanks to the chef Salvador!)
reviews.title: Excellent Holiday!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What we would change... It can be hard to get a chair at the pool unless you get up early, "no reservations" policy (i.e. leaving towels on chairs and daybeds first thing in the morning) not enforced; however there is plenty of space at the beach. You will have to suffer smoke from smoking customers in outdoor restaurants. Service can be hit-or-miss; we had one meal at Thalassa where we had to get up to ask for wine, and food service was very slow... This was an unfortunate exception. In our opinion, the elements listed above are not deal-breakers but things to be aware of, typical of many all-inclusive resorts (I have experienced similar things at 3 other resorts in Punta Cana).
reviews.title: Pleasantly Seamless Luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In summary we are always happy to visit the Catalonia Royal Bavaro and will hopefully return soon. You can have the option of quiet & relaxation, or go visit the resort next door if you want more action!
reviews.title: Amazing couples resort! Peace and beauty!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: We stayed at the Catalonia Royal in October of 2012. We were very happy with the room, amenities, food and service, the latter being exemplary in all aspects. There were a couple of glitches but none so bothersome that are worth mentioning. These were the only reasons for giving a rating of 4 rather than 5. We will definitely be returning to this resort...more than once I'm sure. If you are thinking of vacationing at this resort, by all means do!
reviews.title: Wonderful!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007
reviews.text: The hotel is really pretty, no doubt, but there is this girl from guest services named MARCIAn or somethin like that was the worst we could ever seen, bad attitude, slow in restaurants reservations, bad english, really bad for guest services.
reviews.title: Pretty Hotel, But...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Date: April 10 - 17, 2008
reviews.title: Amazing vacation at the Royal Catalonia

likes.liked: — the rooms were very clean and service excellant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Review is a little lenghty
reviews.title: Incredible Week in the DR

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from the most amazing vacation at the Royal Catalonia Bavaro. Flight from Moncton NB to Punta Cana was fabulous without a hitch, going through the airport in Punta Cana went very smoothly. Bus ride from Airport only took 20 min at most. Once at the hotel bellhop gathered our luggage at Reception they greeted us with champaigne, we were travelling with another couple and requested ahead of time to have a pool facing room with rooms in same villa and floor which was accomodated for us, reception service was smooth and very friendly, once in our room checked everything over they were so clean and sheets were very fresh not sure where other people saw bugs or cockroaches did not even see a mosquitoes, maids cleaned rooms twice a day with lots of fresh flowers and fresh towels no shortage, lots of hot water only thing water pressure wasn't the best but that did not bother us at all. JUpon arrival in our rooms we received a chocolate scupture of a palm tree with shaved white and dark chocolates with triffles. Also all of our Al-a-carts were already made for us which was a bonus. Food at the Thalassa was ok I would say about at 3 out of 5 the breakfasst was the best we loved the Momosa girl, did not have to much of a problem with communication much of their front end staff spoke english to some extent.
reviews.title: catalonia vs royal catalonia

likes.disliked: — insecurity about getting the accommodation we paid for

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We ate at the American Steakhouse , Mexican, Parrisean (french Resaurant) which were all very good, they mixed up our reservation for the Asian but that did not bother us at all we just ate at the grand buffet that night, During the day we ate at the Pizzaria which also served nachos, roast chicken, french fries, hot dogs on the Catalonia side very, very yummy.
reviews.title: Fabulous!

likes.liked: — Wifi in the room, beautiful surroundings
likes.disliked: — water pressure in shower was poor but tub shower ok!

reviews.title: Trip to Punta Cana
reviews.text: Now onto the beach, we are ealy risers so we always went for a walk around 6:45 and 7 am there were plenty of Plapas( spelling?) to choose from, it gets so hot during the afternoon it is nice to get some shade, one afternoon I counted 15 beach chairs vacant so no problem to find them on the beach. Beach bar is very close on the royal side we also had butler service a few days on the beach. Sand was nice and white, others spoke about lots of seeweed on the beach but really there was hardly to speak of when we were there, they cleaned the beach at least twice a day to pick the seaweed up. Water was very warm easy to just jump right in.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a 7 day stay on the Royal side. We had an awesome time and would definitely recommend this resort for the price, service, extra large pool, large beach area, and staff friendliness. Detailed and lengthy report below by category so you don’t have to read everything.
reviews.title: Let me take you there in detail
Fabulous Holiday
reviews.text: Airport: Arrived from Chicago on United airlines, air steps down to ground. They take your photo with colorful natively dressed Dominican girls upon arrival which can be purchased when departing. We had to pay an airport tax of $10 pp cash before entering the immigration line (separate booth). The baggage claim took a while and was crowded. Had to stand in line at the Apple booth to find our transfer driver. The ride was short (less than 15 minutes maybe) but crazy fast and scary at times (lots of passing and getting close to oncoming traffic.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrival: We arrived around 5pm and were dropped off at the main entrance not knowing any better and check in was confusing. The royal side has a separate lobby. They had to drive us and our bags to the other side and then take our bags to our rooms so we tipped three different people for check in. If you arrive between 11 AM-1PM, make your dinner reservations for the week then otherwise you’ll have to wait until the next day. Beach towels are in the rooms already and the maid brings new towels daily (no towel card on the royal side). You get a plastic pouch with two room keys, a schedule of daily pool and beach activities and some excursion brochures. We booked through Apple and had our orientation the following AM. The lobby has a free internet area with two computers, cigarette machine ($5 per pack) a bar and a restaurant that faces the royal pool with an outdoor seating area also.
reviews.title: Enjoyable Experience

likes.liked: — Services available and R&R in the sun

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms: There are four buildings along the royal side of the resort 40, 42, 44, 46. We stayed in villa 44, had a corner room facing the pathway to the beach/garden view. Villas 44 and 46 are closest to the royal pool and have rooms that face the pool if requested. The rooms are a good size, four poster canopy king bed, two person tub (not Jacuzzi), living room area, electronic safe, stand up open marbled shower, patios have hammock and table/chairs. They supply shampoo, conditioner, bath gel, nail file, comb,shower cap, sewing kit and tooth picks. Frig was stocked with Brahma beer, coke, water. There was a coffee maker which we used every late afternoon before dinner and oreos/peanuts. Nice flat screen TV. No dresser but closet had shelving. We left our clothes in our suitcases mostly. Lots of mirrors in the room. Our air conditioner did not work properly and room was musty and the bathroom sink was leaking underneath but as soon as problems were reported, a maintenance person was up to fix them in less then 20 minutes (great service!). We had them bring us a dehumidifier which I highly recommend you ask for. It greatly reduced the musty smell. I also brought a plug in air freshener which helped a little. Hint: if you open the patio door, the air conditioner stops. Need to close door tightly for it to come back on. There was not an iron but I think you can get one if you need it. We did not have any bugs except for one large cricket in the closet and a few small ants. My husband got one mosquito bite. We did not use bug spray the entire stay. You have 24 hr room service on the royal side which we did not use so can’t comment on that. Looked like mostly salads, cheese trays, and sandwiches.
reviews.title: Perfect for Relaxing
No Problem, Go with low expectations and a positive attitude B)
reviews.text: Pools: The Royal pool is secluded from the rest of the resort and guarded for trespassers. It is a good size for a 2nd pool. Nice sturdy padded lounge chairs with palapas and swim up bar. There is also a spa area which I think offers spa treatments (did not get any but I smelled the herbs) and also has a gym and saunas. I discovered this on the last day.

reviews.title: Awesome Vacation
reviews.text: We stayed at the Royal Catalonia and I read a lot of good reviews before leaving but there were a couple of bad ones that were stuck in my head. Therefore, I was really worried about what we should expect. I can now say that there was nothing to worry about. We had an absolutely wonderful time.

reviews.title: Catalonia
reviews.text: I speak very little spanish and was worried about that. Some of the people that work there speak very good english but some of the people speak little to no english. However, we didn't run into a situation where we couldn't get our point across to them or vice versa. My spanish was a little better when I got back home, but then had to remember to say "yes" instead of "si"!

reviews.title: Absolutely brilliant holiday!
reviews.text: Some of the food is different, but it took a couple of days for us to start trying somethings we hadn't had before and were pleasantly surprised. We definitely did not starve and both gained a few pounds while we were there.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The people that work there, work VERY hard. They work long days, and many days in a row for a couple of days off. They all treated us wonderfully and always had a smile. I can't say enough about the friendliness of the Dominican people.
reviews.title: Excellent!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are a lot of other places I would like to see but I definitely want to go back to DR and will definitely stay at the Royal Catalonia again. We did go over to the other side a couple of times and each time were glad that we booked on the Royal side!
reviews.title: Excellent

aka: Catalonia Royal Bavaro Hotel Punta Cana
